page.title: 08KING JOHN'S LODGE ROMSEY
page.content: On 15th May 1915 my Nan was born in King John's Hunting Lodge, the doctor was Dr Van Summers, he was Dutch. In that year King John's Hunting Lodge was called '6 Church Court'. She lived there about 6 years. When she was old enough to work she worked at the Jam Factory. In the summer, work started at 6 am. They worked until 9 am went home for breakfast and went to work at 10 am. They worked for two hours and then went home for dinner went back to work at 1 pm until 4 pm. The Jam Factory was where Waitrose's is now. In the summer the wasps used to sting the workers. In the winter they had to break ice off the top of the barrels of fruit soaking in water. Nowadays King John's house is used for local meetings of up to about 50 people. Pupils from our school perform at poetry and music evenings.
